p.2: The end client is unable to sponsor or transfer visas for this position; all parties authorized to work in the US without sponsorship are encouraged to apply.
p.4: An Entertainment Company is seeking a Data Engineer in REMOTE.
p.8: As a Data Engineer, you will also participate in discovery processes with stakeholders to identify business requirements and expected outcomes. The Data Engineer will also participate in operational support and maintenance of products and services as well as mentor junior team members.
p.9: =E2=80=A2 Design and engineer high-performance/large scale data engineering projects, producing maintainable and secure code with automated testing in a continuous integration environment.
p.10: =E2=80=A2 Develop production grade, consumable data views
p.11: =E2=80=A2 Ensure solutions support all functional and non-functional requirements
p.12: =E2=80=A2 Participate in operational support and maintenance of products and services
p.13: =E2=80=A2 Ability to participate in discovery processes with stakeholders to identify business requirements and expected outcomes
p.14: =E2=80=A2 Coordinate and collaborate with offshore teams
p.15: =E2=80=A2 Ability to mentor to junior team members
p.16: =E2=80=A2 Coordinate and collaborate with offshore teams
p.20: =E2=80=A2 Relevant cloud data engineering work experience
p.21: =E2=80=A2 Ability to perform across multiple phases of development for multiple complex projects, including technical design, build, and end-to-end testing.
p.22: =E2=80=A2 Passionate about delivering data engineering projects and features in a team environment.
p.23: =E2=80=A2 Demonstrate the ability to quickly learn new technologies
p.24: =E2=80=A2 Troubleshooting skills, ability to determine impacts, ability to resolve complex issues, and ability to exercise sound judgment and initiative in stressful situations.
p.25: =E2=80=A2 Strong oral and written communication and interpersonal skills
p.26: =E2=80=A2 Fundamentals of data pipelining, ELT/ETL, data architecture, and the overall data lifecycle
p.27: =E2=80=A2 Cross-platform development languages: Python preferred (Java specialty OK)
p.28: =E2=80=A2 Snowflake data warehouse exposure and experience
p.30: =E2=80=A2 Relational database and NoSQL (ex: MongoDB, DynamoDB, Redis, HBase, Cassandra) database experience
p.31: =E2=80=A2 Cloud technologies including AWS and Google Cloud Platform (GCP)
p.32: =E2=80=A2 Queuing Technology =E2=80=93 Kafka, RabbitMQ, Redis, SQS, Kinesis Streams, Kinesis Firehose
p.33: =E2=80=A2 Data Processing =E2=80=93 EMR, Spark, Glue, Spark Streaming/Flink
p.34: =E2=80=A2 Containers - Docker, Docker Swarm, Docker Applications
p.36: =E2=80=A2 Security - IAM roles, wire encryption, KMS, Kerberos, Authz, AD
p.37: =E2=80=A2 Infrastructure as Code - Terraform, Cloud Formation, CDK
p.38: =E2=80=A2 Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Technology, or related field OR equivalent work experience
p.42: You will be working with a professional recruiter who has intimate knowledge of the industry and market trends. Your Hays recruiter will lead you through a thorough screening process in order to understand your skills, experience, needs, and drivers. You will also get support on resume writing, interview tips, and career planning, so when there=E2=80=99s a position you really want, you=E2=80=99re fully prepared to get it.
